The five kinds of wilderness dwellers [a: A person may be a wilderness dweller because of stupidity and folly.
A person may be a wilderness dweller because of wicked desires, being naturally full of desires.
A person may be a wilderness dweller because of madness and mental disorder.
A person may be a wilderness dweller because it is praised by the Buddhas and their disciples.
A person may be a wilderness dweller for the sake of having few wishes, for the sake of contentment, self-effacement, seclusion, and simplicity.
The qualities of the person who dwells i: The person who dwells in the wilderness for the sake of having few wishes is the foremost.
The person who dwells in the wilderness for the sake of having few wishes is the best.
The person who dwells in the wilderness for the sake of having few wishes is the chief.
The person who dwells in the wilderness for the sake of having few wishes is the highest.
The person who dwells in the wilderness for the sake of having few wishes is the finest.
